column1: Your provider will ask you to temporarily stop taking any medicines that may affect the test results.

Abnormal results are indicated as follows: Higher than normal measurements may indicate: - Heart failure - Loss of body fluids (dehydration) - Narrowing of the kidney artery (renal artery stenosis) - Shock - Sugar (glucose) in the urine - Syndrome of inappropriate ADH secretion (SIADH) Lower than normal measurements may indicate: - Damage to kidney tubule cells (renal tubular necrosis) - Drinking too much fluid - Kidney failure - Severe kidney infection (pyelonephritis)
